Author: domp
Content: haha yeah not so catchy as Wikipedia. I think the restrictions will turn off a lot of people also. Seems like you have to prove that you're a professional in your field. I wonder how they'll regulate that without tediously screening every person on the site.

Author: amichail
Content:
From the blog post:

==

"I want to stress the importance of being young and technical," he stated. If you want to found a successful company, you should only hire young people with technical expertise.

"Young people are just smarter," he said with a straight face. "Why are most chess masters under 30?" he asked. "I don't know," he answered. "Young people just have simpler lives. We may not own a car. We may not have family." In the absence of those distractions, he says, you can focus on big ideologies. He added, "I only own a mattress." Later: "Simplicity in life allows you to focus on what's important."

==

Isn't age discrimination illegal?\n

Author: Constantine
Content: Interesting, I especially liked the idea of interconnecting already popular applications to increase overall functionality.\nAdding iCal would have been trivial compared to the amount of traffic it must have garnered.

Author: Constantine
Content: Yeah, if I have learned anything from watching various startups and the like is that bureaucracy kills you, better to give a small team of developers with concise goals some money and have someone keep them on track. If they need more people then let them explain why, and how they are going to use them.\n

Author: staunch
Content:
Ustream was described as a "poor version of Stickam" in the post :-)

We launched over a year ago on Stickam and have done mobile broadcasts at Techcrunch, Sundance, with Paris Hilton, etc.

We're actually excited about Justin.tv though. It's helping to bring attention to the concept and there's room enough for at least a few big players. We're also very friendly and open to working together -- unless Justin guys feel they need an artificial nemesis :-)

I also personally love it since I'm a big YC fan, enjoyed using Kiko, and generally love streaming technology.

Author: danielha
Content:
Jeez, that name is terrible.

Making that contribution system closed is going to kill a lot of the appeal that made Wikipedia so popular.

Author: domp
Title: Citizendium: A new Wikipedia competitor with more contributor responsibility

Author: Constantine
Content: Wow, that is an amazing amount, I will be very interested to see what they can accomplish with this amount, I checked out their site and it makes me very hopeful! \n

Author: domp
Content: Thanks for the feedback, Ryan. Seems like it was a great time this year.
